question: The fossil of Australopithecus “Little foot” has been discovered in which country?
explanation:
"Little Foot" is the nickname given to a nearly complete Australopithecus fossil skeleton found in 1994–1998 in the cave system of Sterkfontein, South Africa.
The nickname "little foot" was given to the fossil in 1995. This discovery is said to provide more insights on the origin of human beings.
